721409f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, west side, south from E. 59th Street, showing a panoramic arrangement as viewed from a structure at the N.E. corner of this point. Buildings shown line the west side of this thoroughfare, south from 59th (right of No. 3), across 58th to 57th Streets. Under construction is a modern 10 story office building replacing the old Blass Theatre and its adjoining structure. This will be knows as 6134 Madison Avenue and is the property of J.D. Grimmins. The two large corner buildings appearing are the Bankers Trust (57th Street) and the Madison, an apartment hotel at 58th Street.

June 5, 1929
Views 1,2,3

F.L. Sparr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

721408f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, east side, looking north from 59th Street, showing Madison Avenue Methodist Episcopal Church, now (1935) occupied
by a Swedish congregation.
December 21, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

714013f-a.text:
41 and 43 East 59th Street, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Madison Ave. The Tuxedo, a 4-story structure directly at the corner, is
partially seen on the extreme left.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

714014f-a.text:
(1)
21 to 3 East 59th Street, north side, west from Madison to Fifth Aves. and showing prominently a new 2-story structure at the N.W. corner of Madison Ave. that bears No. 21 East 59th Street, and 640 Madison Ave. This edifice replaced the 10-story Hoffman Arms. Continuing west of same are three 4-story structures, Nos. 19 to 15 inclusive. The Plaza Art Building (No. 13-9) was formerly called the Monroe Building. West of the 7-story structure (No. 7-5) that adjoins the latter,is the Sherry Netherland Hotel which is at the N.E. corner of Fifth Ave.
and bears No. 3 (also 873 Fifth Ave.)
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A detail.of same and showing mainly Nos. 13-9 and 7-5; the first
being the Plaza Art Building.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

714014f-b.text:
(1)
21 to 3 East 59th Street, north side, west from Madison to Fifth Aves. and showing prominently a new 2-story structure at the N.W. corner of Madison Ave. that bears No. 21 East 59th Street, and 640 Madison Ave. This edifice replaced the 10-story Hoffman Arms. Continuing west of same are three 4-story structures, Nos. 19 to 15 inclusive. The Plaza Art Building (No. 13-9) was formerly called the Monroe Building. West of the 7-story structure (No. 7-5) that adjoins the latter,is the Sherry Netherland Hotel which is at the N.E. corner of Fifth Ave.
and bears No. 3 (also 873 Fifth Ave.)
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A detail.of same and showing mainly Nos. 13-9 and 7-5; the first
being the Plaza Art Building.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

714015f-a.text:
East 59th Street, north side, east from No. 15 (left) a point slightly west of Madison Ave., and across same. Shown at the N.W. and N.E. corNners of the latter respectively are; a new 2-story business structure and the 4-story Tuxedo. Further eastward is the huge Hotel Delmonico, a
towered edifice at the N.W. corner of Park Ave.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
